citation.article-title: Desulfitobacterium hafniense sp. nov., an anaerobic, reductively dechlorinating bacterium.

p.s: Description of Desulfitobacterium hafniense sp. nov.
Desulfitobacterium hafniense (haf. ni. en' se. M. L. n. Hafnia, Copenhagen; L. suff. -ensis, native of; M. L. adj. hafniense, native of Copenhagen, referring to the place of isolation)
Morphology.

Cells are rod shaped and gram negative and occur singly, in pairs, and in short chains; they are approximately 3.3 to 6 μm long and 0.6 to 0.7 μm wide and motile and have one or two terminal flagella.
Spores are formed, and the spores are terminal.
Physiology.
Obligate anaerobe.
At pH 7 the optimum growth temperature is near 37°C.
Only pyruvate and tryptophan support growth.
Acetate, CO2, 2,4-dichlorophenol, and 4-chlorophenol are formed during growth with pyruvate and 2,4,6-trichlorophenol.

L-Arabinose, D-glucose, D-fructose, D-galactose, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, cellobiose, xylose, lactose, maltose, mannose, sucrose, raffinose, trehalose, D-mannitol, benzoate, lactate, acetate, butyrate, propionate, formate, fumarate, sorbitol, salicin, inulin, starch, glycerol, esculin, L-histidine, L-(+)-glutamhe, L-threonine, and L-phenylalanine do not support growth.

There is no sulfate reduction or growth in the presence of sulfate with the following carbon sources: formate, benzoate, lactate, glycerol, maltose, lactose, mannitol, acetate, glucose, propionate, butyrate, rhamnose, ribose, arabinose, galactose, mannose, and fucose.

There is no growth when thiosulfate is added as an electron acceptor with following carbon sources: L-arabinose, D-glucose, D-fructose, D-galactose, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, fucose, mannose, raffinose, D-mannitol, lactate, acetate, butyrate, propionate, and formate.

There is no growth when 2,4,6-trichlorophenol is added as an electron acceptor with following carbon sources: L-arabinose, D-glucose, D-galactose, D-ribose, lactose, maltose, glycerol, benzoate, lactate, acetate, butyrate, propionate, and formate.
Reduces nitrate to ammonia and nitrite.
Thiosulfate, sulfite, and Fe(III) are also reduced in the presence of pyruvate.
Does not reduce Mn(IV) or sulfate in the presence of pyruvate.
Reductively dechlorinates pentachlorophenol, 2,4,5-trichlorophenol, 2,4,6-trichlorophenol, 2,4-dichlorophenol, 3,5-dichlorophenol, and 3-Cl-4OHPA.
Does not dechlorinate 3,4,5-trichlorophenol, 3,4-dichlorophenol, 2-chlorophenol, 3-chlorophenol, and 4-chlorophenol.
Conserves energy from reductive dechlorination of 3-Cl-4OHPA.
Contains cytochrome c but no desulfoviridin.
Indole positive and catalase negative.
Does not liquify gelatin.
The cellular DNA G+C content is 47 mol%.
Isolated from municipal sludge.
Desulfitobacterium hafniense DCB-2T has been deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen GmbH.
